title: Calories in Roast Beef
meta_description: Discover calories in roast beef per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Lean cut (top round), oven-roasted, trimmed of visible fat, no added salt, oil, or gravy.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, and brand; values are averages. Check labels or use a scanner for precision.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of lean roast beef provides ~179 kcal and ~28 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g roast beef?
faqs.a: About 179 kcal for lean, cooked roast beef.

faqs.q: What's the protein in roast beef?
faqs.a: Approximately 28 g protein per 100 g serving.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain roast beef.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in roast beef?
faqs.a: Roasting reduces moisture, concentrating calories; overcooking can slightly increase density.
Lean cuts have ~6.8 g fat per 100 g; choose trimmed versions to keep it under 10 g.
